comments.author: @SingWithAnandKishore
comments.text:
Share these truthful details to all ✌️😊
This is NOT meant for comparison. It's simply to get the clarity of truth of their performance in their best ODI WCs so far, which 99.99% people including me, were not fully aware until now ☹️😊

Full clarity with match wise details of their best ODI WCs, for the all the people ✌️😊
All hate nitpickers ignored, check these scores on cric scorecards if any doubt 👍
G : Groupstage
K : Knockouts

In short :
Sachin has performed consistently well above atleast 44% success rate in 3 ODI WC with WC2003 being his best, while Kohli has done that so far in 2 ODI WC with WC2023 being his best 👌✌️😊

In full detail :
Successful good innings means minimum of 50 runs scored for team in an innings. Reason is, every good batsman is obviously expected to contribute minimum of 50 runs with fairly good consistency ✌️😊


SACHIN -

WC1996 :
(Almost 23 years old)
[ Success rate of 71.43%, 5 good innings out of 7, with 2 failures namely, 3 vs ZIM & 31 vs PAK ]
G : 127* 70 90 137 3
K : 31 65

WC2003 :
(Almost 30 years old)
[ Success rate of 63.64%, 7 good innings out of 11, with 4 failures namely, 36 & 4 both vs AUS, and 5 vs KEN & 15 vs NZ ]
G : 52 36 81 152 50 98 5 97 15
K : 83 4

WC2011 :
(Almost 38 years old)
[ Success rate of 44.44%, only 4 good innings out of 9, with 5 failures namely, 28 vs BAN, 38 vs IRE, 27 vs NED, 2 vs WI, and 18 vs SL ]
G : 28 120 38 27 111 2
K : 53 85 18


Kohli -

WC2015 :
(Almost 26.5 years old)
[ Success rate of only 37.5%, with 3 good innings (including the unbeaten ones) out of 8, surely way below the Kohli standards, with 5 failures namely, 46 vs SA, 33 vs WI, 38 vs ZIM, and 2 knockouts failures of 3 vs BAN & 1 vs AUS ]
G : 107 46 33* 33 44* 38
K : 3 1

WC2019 :
(About 30.5 years old)
[ Success rate of 55.56%, 5 good innings out of 9, 34* was fine when he completed the win formality with majority work already done, with 3 failures of 18 vs SA, 26 vs BAN & 1 vs NZ ]
G : 18 82 77 67 72 66 26 34*
K : 1

WC2023 :
(Almost 35 years old)
[ Success rate of 81.82%, 9 good innings out of 11, with 2 failures of 16 vs PAK & 0 vs ENG ]
G : 85 55* 16 103* 95 0 88 101* 51
K : 117 54

comments.author: @SingWithAnandKishore
comments.text:
SHARE THIS TO ALL ✌️👌
All those who blindly demean Sachin and blindly say Ponting or any other to be better than Sachin in knockouts and overall consistency.... 😊
Sachin has scored well in 1996SEMIS CT1998QF CT2000FINAL 2003SEMIS 2011QF 2011SEMIS. Show me if Ponting or other player has scored atleast 50 runs in 6 different icc knockouts, and more importantly Sachin has done this alongwith scoring consistently till SEMIS of 3 different ODI WCs of 1996 2003 and even 2011 🙄😊
By the way, no player ever has consistently performed well and made team win individually by his own efforts in every single match including Final of ODI WC, even GILLY PONTING etc. haven't performed in every game of any WC consistently from 1st match till Final. So, better understand that other players in team MUST perform with atleast half consistency in most games in WC, which real culprits like 1996 Azhar Prabhakar Kambli Manjrekar, 1999 Azhar Mongia etc. and 2003 Dravid Yuvi Kaif Ganguly DineshMongia etc. never showed ever in any WC. 🙄☹️
Same applies when Kohli alone (or any other consistent runscorer) is targeted instead of other real culprits 🙄

And if you're so desperate for comparison, then compare same era players only with same peak year phases, unlike Sachin peak years from 1991 to 1998 & Mcgrath peak years from 1999 to 2007. Recall how Sachin has treated Mcgrath in WC1996 game, that's his original evergreen form, which was never there post his last peak year of 1998 ☺️
Polite like-minded evidence based replies welcome.
Rest all ignored 👋
